articles.author: John Carter
articles.title: NASA plans mission to study asteroid Psyche
articles.description: NASA is preparing to launch its Psyche mission to explore the metal-rich asteroid Psyche 16, which could reveal secrets of planetary formation.
articles.content: The Psyche mission is set to launch this fall and will study the unique metal-rich asteroid orbiting between Mars and Jupiter...

articles.author: Sarah Johnson
articles.title: Asteroid passes safely by Earth
articles.description: A 300-meter-wide asteroid made a close but safe approach to Earth on Thursday, according to NASA's Planetary Defense Coordination Office.
articles.content: The asteroid came within 3.5 million kilometers of Earth, posing no threat but giving scientists a valuable observation opportunity...

articles.author: Michael Lee
articles.title: Mining asteroids: The future of space economy
articles.description: Private companies are racing to develop technology to mine asteroids for valuable metals such as platinum, nickel, and gold.
articles.content: Asteroid mining could become a trillion-dollar industry, but challenges in technology and international law remain...

articles.author: Dr. Emily Foster
articles.title: How asteroids shaped Earth's history
articles.description: From the extinction of the dinosaurs to the delivery of water, asteroids have played a crucial role in shaping our planet's past.
articles.content: Asteroids have been both a destructive and constructive force in Earth's history...

articles.author: Laura Smith
articles.title: The mysterious origins of near-Earth asteroids
articles.description: Scientists are piecing together the history of near-Earth asteroids to understand where they come from and how they evolve.
articles.content: Near-Earth asteroids may originate from collisions in the asteroid belt and are gradually pulled into Earth's neighborhood...
